name: TransnetBW GmbH
goal:
TransnetBW operates the electricity transmission grid in Baden-Württemberg, a federal state located in the southwest of Germany. The network consists of around 3,200 kilometres of 220kV and 380kV extra high voltage power lines, and more than 80 transformers connect the grid to the 110kV regional distribution grids. Robust power networks are essential to ensuring a reliable energy supply, and form the cornerstone of a thriving economy and society. As a transmission grid operator, we are responsible for operating, maintaining, planning and expanding the transmission network.
We make the transmission grid available to all market participants on transparent, non-discriminatory terms, and we guarantee a reliable power supply around the clock. We continuously manage and monitor energy flows across our network, and are responsible for maintaining and expanding the grid. Our customers and partners include power plant operators, distribution system operators and several hundred electricity traders.
The TransnetBW grid is integrated into the national and European networks – in France, Austria and Switzerland – through numerous interconnection points located at the control area borders.
Furthermore we are responsible for the implementation of several national and european laws and regulations:

On the national level we cooportate with the other TSOs in order to propose and implement the german network development plan (Netzentwicklungsplan) and the requirements of the law on the expansion of energy conductors (Energieleiterausbaugesetz). This also includes the Projects of Common Interest in our control area.

On the euopean level we participate in the development and implementation of ENTSO-E Network Codes as well as several Guidelines as part of our membership in the European Network of Transmission System Operators (ENTSO-E). In this context we also coordinate with TSOs from all over Europe.
interests: Climate Action, Competition, Energy, Environment, Internal Market, Research and Technology, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives:
We observe mainly projects in the areas of energy and environment, especially on the topics of grid development and regulation of the energy market. Currently, we are dealing with the following projects:

Clean Energy Package of the European Commission (Clean Energy for All Europeans),
Amendment of the Regulation of Trans-European Networks (TEN-E),
Amendment of the Regulation of Projects of Common Interest (PCI),
Amendment of the Renewable Energy Sources Directive (RES),
Different recommendations and decisions of the European Agency for the Cooperation of Energy Regulators (ACER).
